p: A 34-year-old previously healthy male presented with high grade fever associated with constitutional symptoms of five days' duration. He was complaining of right hypochondrium pain and tea-coloured urine for two days associated with yellowish discolouration of the eyes. He had severe loss of appetite to food and water, but his bowel habits had been normal throughout the illness. On admission, he was afebrile with normal vital signs but was deeply icteric. His abdominal examination revealed a tender, mild hepatomegaly while his cardiovascular, respiratory, and nervous system examination was normal.
